channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Why preorders are such a big deal for authors
item.description: Special gifts. Great stories. And economics too!? Can it be true? The Planet Money book is available for preorder.

item.title: How flights are impacted by the government shutdown. And, James Comey's arraignment
item.description: Air traffic controllers are facing a staffing shortage and the government shutdown is making it worse. And, former FBI Director James Comey appears in...

item.title: Famed polar exploration ship Endurance not as strong as legend held, researcher says
item.description: Antarctic explorer Ernest Shackleton's crew famously survived after the Endurance became stuck in ice in 1915. A researcher says the ship was ill-equi...

item.title: Research on metal-organic frameworks gets the chemistry Nobel Prize
item.description: Susumu Kitagawa, Richard Robson and Omar M. Yaghi will share the prize. Their structures can "capture carbon dioxide, store toxic gases or catalyse ch...

item.title: Pumpkin: A favorite sign of fall, with a bit of shady history
item.description: Pumpkins are a harvest symbol and part of our nostalgia for a simpler time. But while the word "pumpkin" has been around for centuries, the plant date...

item.title: Hurricane Priscilla weakening but still powerful off Mexico's Pacific coast.
item.description: Hurricane Priscilla was beginning to lose some punch but was still a powerful Category 2 storm off Mexico's Pacific coast, the Miami-based National Hu...

item.title: Israeli forces intercept new aid flotilla bound for Gaza
item.description: Activists on board nine vessels carrying food and medical supplies for Palestinians will be deported, Israel says.

item.title: Tropical Storm Jerry churns over central Atlantic Ocean
item.description: Tropical Storm Jerry continued to churn over tropical waters of the central Atlantic Ocean and was likely to become a hurricane.

item.title: At least 24 killed as army paraglider bombs Myanmar Buddhist festival
item.description: Locals tell the BBC the carnage has made it hard to identify victims of the military attack.

item.title: National Guard troops are outside Chicago and could be in Memphis soon in Trump’s latest deployment
item.description: National Guard troops are positioned outside Chicago and they could soon be in Memphis as the Trump administration pushes ahead with an aggressive pol...

item.title: Man dies days after being charged in 1973 killing of Connecticut woman
item.description: Police charged George Legere, 77, with murder after he confessed to fatally stabbing 21-year-old Janet Couture in her East Hartford apartment.

item.title: Ex-FBI chief James Comey in court today for arraignment — here's what to expect
item.description: Former FBI Director James Comey, a longtime foe of President Trump, will appear in Virginia for an arraignment, in his first court appearance since be...

item.title: Nigerian minister accused of forging qualifications resigns
item.description: The forgery allegations have sparked outrage among some Nigerians, following a newspaper exposé.

item.title: 9/3: CBS Morning News
item.description: President Trump vows to deploy National Guard to Chicago to help fight crime; North Korea's Kim Jong Un joins leaders at military parade in Beijing.

item.title: Burkina Faso junta detains NGO workers for 'spying'
item.description: The security minister says the NGO "collected and passed on sensitive security information" - which it denies.

item.title: Trump-backed Van Epps and Democrat Behn win Tennessee primaries for US House special election
What we know about National Guard deployment in Chicago and Oregon
